relation: Categories
Campus Safety
Greek Life
Clubs and Activities
Great for these types of students
Share any unusual traditions or locations on campus
Bang for the buck
What to do for fun
Food and Dining
Dorm Life
Academic Rigor
Tips for prospective students
In three sentences
Comments

I feel really safe here! And the kids as a whole are very honest. My friend lost her wallet recently and someone found it and turned it into the police without taking anything. That doesn't happen everywhere!
Greek Life is a pretty huge part of Purdue, but don't feel like you won't have any friends if you decide not to rush. I didn't, and I still have plenty of friends and a whole lot of fun.
Purdue has such a variety of clubs and organizations that there is really something for everyone!
This school is great for all kinds of students, but especially for kids who like to learn and have a great time doing it.
Breakfast Club and the IU sucks cheer you will learn about in good time. Also, fountain runs are the bomb, but NOT in the freezing rain.
I'm an in state student, so for the incredibly low amount of money I am receiving an education for a very well known, quality university.
There are a lot of groups around campus that you can be a part of. Pay attention during call out week!

I love the food! Except the week before Christmas Break when it's leftover time. But all the other times the food is awesome. I have yet to get tired of it, and the holiday meals at the dining courts are amazing.
The rooms are nice and people are very friendly. However, it gets LOUD. I get woken up in the middle of the night pretty often.
I always have something to keep me busy, and you can tell that I have learned a lot!

Try and really reach out during BGR, but don't feel bad if you don't click with the people from your group! My best friends were ones that I met through my roommate. Also, if you want to get an apartment, sign in October to get the best choice! We signed early November, and we were almost too late!
Purdue is such a kind, friendly atmosphere! The work is hard, but you know it will pay off in the end. I love this school!
pageTitle: Purdue University Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {83635=Everyone has to go on a fountain run at least once while they are attending purdue. Usually, after a winning home game, the student section will sprint across campus and run through the two fountains in celebration. It is especially great on hot days in august and september! Also, you have to make a stop at the discount den and buy a den pop (yes, we call it pop, not soda). A den pop allows you to mix different drinks together, all for a cheap price., 886002=There are over 1000 clubs on campus, I'm sure you can find something!, 168321=Definitely take a tour. This lets you get a feel for the dorms and how far they will be from your classes. If your from out of state, definitely ask about the weather. Several of my friends had to make emergency trips to Walmart because they didn't have any winter clothing. If you can, try leaving your winter clothes at home for the warm months, and then switching your wardrobe over a break, so that you don't bring more clothes than you have room for, because you won't need that cute turtleneck sweater in August., 1103428=When you apply, be creative and be yourself. Apply by November 1st so that you can be considered for Scholarships and Honors College., 124742=Friday night's before home football games there is a walk with the team over the bridge . textAfterTable: Am learning a lot I am in the nursing program and joined a learning community. This is where around 20 freshman nursing students get put in most of the same classes and are put in the same resident hall. This helps with finding people to study with and is a great way to easily make some new friends. Most of the programs have learning communities and I would recommend getting into one. It is not absolutely necessary for success in college but it might help make things a little bit easier. Login to rate or flag the reviews Cody from Lake Village, IN 08/10/2009 Reviewer is A current student here. 20 out of 20 people found this review useful. 3 of 322 Categories Comments Great for these types of students Purdue is great for ANY student, but specifically, students looking to major in science, technology, engineering, mathematics, or pharmacy are probably the best candidates for the college.
